Key Match Events: The United States’ winning streak at the T20 Cricket World Cup has been ended with a seven-wicket defeat to India
Saurabh Netravalkar dismissed Virat Kohli and captain Rohit Sharma cheaply
A skidding delivery from Ali Khan snuck through Rishabh Pant’s defence to leave India reeling at 39 for three
Miscellaneous Highlights: The U.S. could not have got off to a worse start as opening batter Shayan Jahangir was out to the first ball of the game
Others: The tournament co-hosts pulled off one of the great shocks in their previous match with a super-over victory against Pakistan
India won the toss and chose to bowl first
The U.S. battled well to set a target of 110 but saw that total chased down with 10 balls to spare as they were dealt their first defeat of the tournament
Handy knocks from Harmeet Singh and Shadley van Schalkwyk moved the total into three figures
The wicket of Taylor brought Corey Anderson to the crease
A strong batting performance on a tough pitch from Nitish was brought to an end by an excellent catch on the boundary from Mohammed Siraj
The U.S. made an unacceptable error that cost them five runs
The U.S. still have a chance to qualify for the next round
Either of those matches being rained off with no result would send the U.S. into the Super Eights
The match is scheduled to start at 10:30am ET/7:30am PT with the toss taking place half an hour before
